name: Albergo del Sole Al Pantheon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms are so much larger than we were expecting and with a view of the Pantheon! Wow!. The Continental breakfast was astounding with every kind of ham cheese or bread imaginable and lots else too. The dining area is a shaded roof top beautifully furnished and so relaxing.
reviews.title: What a 1st stay in Europe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012
reviews.text: I had never been to Rome before ,and the experience at the Hotel Del Sole Al Pantheon made the fun of Italy more enjoyable!:)
reviews.title: I had a lovely time there is no place like it in the world , amazing!:)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved waking up in the morning to the smell of a delicious breakfast!:) Breakfast was always a treat with great new things to try and favorites everyone loves!:)
reviews.title: Bedroom with a view to 2000 years back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we first got there they helped us with our luggage and escorted us to our rooms. Everyone there was helpful and very kind and spoke English pretty well!
reviews.title: Bedroom with a view to 2000 years back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: My personal opinion o the Hotel Del Sole is that it's a wonderful experience I will never forget, I mean looking out your window at an ancient wonder isn't really forgettable but not only that. but i am positive that anyone that goes there will have a wonderful time!:)
reviews.title: Location, Location and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just back from a 2 night stay at the Hotel Sole al Pantheon, we booked a suite in their annex building, which was spacious enough for our family of 4. We had 2 bedrooms and a beautiful marble bathroom, but the best thing was the view of the Pantheon from both our bedroon windows. It was such a treat to sit at the window and watch the world go by in the Piazza della Rotonda. The main hotel is just across the square, the staff were helpful and very welcoming and the breakfast was varied. The hotel is situated right in the middle of Rome and we walked to all the sites. I would definetly reccomend this hotel and look forward to staying here again in the near future.
reviews.title: Room with a Spectacular View !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: no aircondition; electricity doesn't work, diferent bulding - you need to walk far
reviews.title: family rooms are not part of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the dinning room is far in the main bulding
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, fabulous location, loved it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the staff is only one man that changes uniform,
reviews.title: Nice Stay near Pantheon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: didn't wait for us with breakfast as promised
reviews.title: Just love this albergo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My daughter, BFF and her son stayed at the Sole Al Pantheon for 3 nights at the end of June. We had just completed a 12 day cruise and were exhausted but ready to experience Rome. This was my third trip but my friend and her son's first.
reviews.title: Fabulous: Location, Location, Location

likes.disliked: — Beds a little hard....but I like a very soft bed..staff accomidated....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: I selected this hotel based on reviews off of this website and its wonderful LOCATION. It is the best location if you are staying in Rome....close to everything...we walked every where...even to the Vatican and Coloseum.
reviews.title: central location, great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed in one of the junior suites that overlooked the square/Pantheon. This was fabulous...and what I would recommend.
reviews.title: Great location, breakfast and helpful staff, especially the manager!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All staff were wonderful.
reviews.title: Hated everything but the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was the best I have ever had in Europe!
reviews.title: Wonderful!
Fabulous location, great hotel
reviews.text: The hotel overlooks the pantheon - one of the best preserved sites in Rome.

reviews.title: Great location, overrated.
reviews.text: Hotel is lovely - good service & nice rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast isn't great but sufficient - cold continental food only.
reviews.title: Beautiful View, Great Location

likes.disliked: — Air conditioning could have been better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definately return.
reviews.title: A Positive Experience

likes.liked: — Location and size of the suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife did the tour of Italy on our honeymoon, starting in Venice, going to Florence, then Rome, then Positano. This was the only really disappointing hotel. We stayed just one night. The rooms were dark, musty, and the bathroom smelled mildewy. We asked for a better room, but were told it was the best one. I have to confess that you can see the Pantheon from the window, but that is the only saving grace. It amazes me that this place is featured in so many design hotel books and articles. Needs a serious overhaul.
reviews.title: Great Location in the Center of Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed 5 nights at the Albergo del Sole Al Pantheon and had a glorious stay. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, the room was fantastic and the view could not be beaten. My favorite part was coming back in the evening after a long hot day of sight seeing and throwing open my window and shutters and taking in the view of the pantheon and then enjoying the street performers and listening to the tinkling of music float through the air as I enjoyed a nice cold beer. Bliss.
reviews.title: Best location in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: We highly recommend this small, charming hotel especially if you are active vacationers like ourselves, who spend very little time in our rooms, and have just a few days to take in wonderful Rome.
reviews.title: Perfect location and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It provides a very "homey" atmosphere. The staff is cheerful and can help you with anything. For walking acess to all of the historic sites in Rome, the location in this bustling Piazza is ideal. Our room faced the inner courtyard and was very quiet. The included, cold breakfast buffet was very good with many items to choose from (even Prosecco!) and there was no waiting, which gave us more time to get going on our day. However, there are so many charming cafes and gelaterias to choose from, which surround the Piazza. The only issue we had was that our A/C wasn't working well, if at all. Since we were there in late May,
reviews.title: Brilliant location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: we opened up our windows, used our ceiling fan and were fine. (We did let the staff know at check-out.)
reviews.title: We'll be back! Great location, Friendly Service and Good Breakfast!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you are a vacationer who needs a large, fancy room and lobby, this is not the place to stay. If you enjoy history and charm, and need a clean, homelike place to stay, this is your hotel.
reviews.title: Great location, great breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel was perfect for our family of four. Two rooms with one overlooking the Pantheon. The rooms are small, but who spends much time in the room in Rome? We walked to everything except the Vatican. Breakfast was not only beautifully presented but delicious. Even the coffee, American-style, was good. The desk was helpful with restaurant suggestions and the free internet access near the lobby was very helpful. The location alone makes this hotel worthy of high marks, but the atmosphere and service was perfect.
reviews.title: Perfect for our first visit to Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A friend & I just returned from a 4 night stay at this marvelously quaint little hotel. We wanted something near all the attractions & something with lots of atmosphere & character. It is located directly across the piazza from the Pantheon & has been a hotel since the 1500's so it offered both those things. We had a twin bedded room which was small, but not cramped. I have stayed in a lot smaller hotel rooms in Europe. The people at the front desk were extremely friendly & helpful, the European style buffet breakfast was terrific, & the room was kept very clean. If you are looking for a ultra-modern, cookie cutter, chain type hotel, this is definitly not the one for you, but if you are looking for a real Roman experience you can't beat the Sole al Pantheon. Yes, it's pricey, but worth every penny. If I ever return to Rome this is where I'll stay!
reviews.title: What A Great Little Hotel!!

likes.disliked: — There wasn't anything I didn't like

reviews.title: lovely break in Rome
reviews.text: We had a wonderful time in Rome in March this year. Our origanal holiday was cancelled in February because of the snow!! The weather was ideal not too hot but warm enough to wear tee shirts. The hotel was great Leonardo the Concierge was very nice and gave us lots of useful information about where to eat and what to do on our first day.

reviews.title: What a Location!
reviews.text: We had a standard double room which overlooked the breakfast courtyard. The breakfast was exceptional and it was a lovely setting. The room was small but the bath with jacuzzi made up for it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we found all the staff helpful and friendly. We were able to walk everywhere from this central hotel. We loved it!
reviews.title: Felt like in three star in Egypt!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the oldest hotel in Rome and is right beside the Pantheon, in fact, if you can get a fron facing room you will be able to look out onto the piazza and see the Pantheon. The reception is very small and has a downstairs bar which wasn't opened when we were there. The breakfast is very good - usual breads, cheeses, cold meats as well as cereal - and is served in the central outside courtyard in the center of the hotel. The rooms are all individually designed but are older, this, however fits with the hotels age. The lift is very small. Its quite a quirky hotel with the stairs running all over the place but totally charming for that. The reception staff are very friendly and rooms are very chean. All in all a brilliant old hotel in a brilliant position!
reviews.title: Fantatically positioned

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recommended by a friend who stayed here- i was blown away by the hotel website information and first and foremost the views from the hotel rooms overlooking rotonda and the pantheon....absolutely amazing ...views to take your breath away.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC BEST HOTEL IN ROME

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I booked a deluxe double room with pantheon view- when you book make sure the room states 'pantheon view'.
reviews.title: If you get the penthouse, it's the most beautiful view in all of Rome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also emailed the hotel several times due to date changes and confirmations and they were great- really helpful and got back to me quickly.
reviews.title: A great little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are beautifull, staff helpful and breakfast there is fab, 7am-10am from what i remember - lots of variety.
reviews.title: The best location in Rome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hard to review this hotel.
reviews.title: Got my money's worth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been to Rome several times in the past, so we knew the location very well, and that was the reason we selected this hotel.
reviews.title: Best Location and View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in the suite in the annex portion of the hotel, room 311.
reviews.title: Lovely Old Hotel -- Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location is great, right on Piazza Rotunda, you can easily walk to any attraction in the city. From the hotel, it's about 35 minute walk to the Coliseum or Vatican, and 20 minutes to Piazza di Spagna - 3 locations on completely opposite ends of the historical center. All the other attractions are within this triangle - so you are close to everything.
reviews.title: Beware

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The suite is very large - more than adequate for 2 people, would be fine for 3 (daybed in sitting area). Opens directly onto the plaza, with great great view of the Pantheon.
reviews.title: Great location

aka: Albergo Del Sole Al Pantheon Hotel Rome
